definition: up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: But anti-China rhetoric is hot in Washington and among many state and local officials.
sentences.chinese: 反中国的言论在华盛顿各级官员中间此起彼伏。

sentences.english: Just as fashions come and go, standards for appropriate dress continue to change.
sentences.chinese: 正如时尚的此起彼伏，穿着打扮的标准也一直在改变。

sentences.english: There were groans all around the room.
sentences.chinese: 房间里弥漫着此起彼伏的叹息声。

sentences.english: The danger of war is looming, and hot issues keep cropping up.
sentences.chinese: 战争阴云挥之不去，热点问题此起彼伏。

sentences.english: Change is constant in your world requiring adaptability and courage.
sentences.chinese: 改变需要灵活多变与勇气，它在你的世界里此起彼伏。

sentences.english: The oboe and cello sat alone , echoing tone for tone.
sentences.chinese: 双簧管和大提琴双重奏，音调此起彼伏。

sentences.english: The breeze hollowed out undulations in the magnificent enormity of the chestnut-trees.
sentences.chinese: 和风使高大华美的栗树丛此起彼伏，气势雄伟。

sentences.english: Filling sound come and go, this is our class cheerleader voice.
sentences.chinese: 加油声此起彼伏，这是我们班的拉拉队发出的声音。

sentences.english: Firecrackers numerous, happiness is their I not happy.
sentences.chinese: 鞭炮声此起彼伏，快乐是他们的，我却不快乐。

sentences.english: Shots one after another, high-level hotel room windows out of the thick white smoke.
sentences.chinese: 枪声此起彼伏，饭店高层房间窗户冒出浓浓的白烟。

sentences.english: Although crossed this, often in safety difficulty, but his crisis all the time as one falls.
sentences.chinese: 常平安虽然过了这道难关，但他的危机一直此起彼伏。

sentences.english: Come and go, but as soon as the tsunami hit and then complain incessantly when.
sentences.chinese: 此起彼伏，而一旦如海啸般袭来的时候再叫苦不迭。

sentences.english: Accounting information forge cases rise one after another.
sentences.chinese: 会计信息造假案此起彼伏，股市人心涣散。

sentences.english: There was one verbal attack right after the other, for roughly an hour.
sentences.chinese: 将近一小时内，口头攻击此起彼伏。

sentences.english: Come and go, all because the pain of those illnesses are often ambience.
sentences.chinese: 此起彼伏，全因为那些疾痛往往是若有似无。

sentences.english: The international and regional hot issues rise one after another.
sentences.chinese: 国际和地区热点问题此起彼伏。

definition: (of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
see 此起彼伏[ci3 qi3 bi3 fu2]
to spring up everywhere/from all around
to wail like ghosts and howl like wolves (idiom)
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
hanging by a thread/very precarious/almost extinct/(of sound) linger on faintly
